children.name: Competition Policy
children.para: c("\xa0Improved\xa0regulatory\xa0environment\xa0for\xa0private\xa0investment. Challenges:\xa0 ? Lack\xa0of\xa0dynamism\xa0in\xa0the\xa0formal\xa0private\xa0sector\xa0in\xa0terms\xa0of\xa0 business\xa0entry\xa0,\xa0growth,\xa0and\xa0innovation\xa0 ? Policy\xa0 distortions\xa0 and\xa0 a\xa0 weak\xa0 Competition\xa0 framework\xa0 constraint\xa0 Competition\xa0 and\xa0 skew\xa0 investment\xa0 towards\xa0 large,\xa0capital?intensive\xa0firms\xa0that\xa0do\xa0not\xa0create\xa0jobs.\xa0\xa0 ? Complexity\xa0 of\xa0 the\xa0 regulatory\xa0 environment,\xa0 unequal\xa0 access\xa0 to\xa0 regulatory\xa0 services,\xa0 and\xa0 weak\xa0 insolvency\xa0 framework\xa0creates\xa0uncertainty\xa0for\xa0businesses\xa0and\xa0inhibits\xa0 entry\xa0and\xa0exit.\xa0\xa0 ? Poor\xa0value\xa0chain\xa0linkages\xa0and\xa0access\xa0to\xa0markets,\xa0including\xa0 in\xa0terms\xa0of\xa0spatial\xa0integration\xa0between\xa0Lower\xa0and\xa0Upper\xa0 Egypt.\xa0 ? Low\xa0 youth\xa0 employability\xa0 (especially\xa0 among\xa0 university\xa0 graduates)\xa0due\xa0to\xa0skills\xa0mismatch\xa0impacting\xa0firm\xa0growth.\xa0 Solutions suported by the WBG: Systemic\xa0reforms\xa0that\xa0simplify\xa0regulations,\xa0reduce\xa0 disparate\xa0treatment\xa0in\xa0their\xa0implementation\xa0and\xa0 eliminate\xa0barriers\xa0to\xa0Competition,\xa0in\xa0particular\xa0at\xa0 the\xa0sector\xa0level.\xa0 ? Reforming\xa0 processes\xa0 for\xa0 incoming\xa0 investment,\xa0 industrial\xa0 licensing,\xa0 permits,\xa0 industrial\xa0 land\xa0 allocation,\xa0and\xa0the\xa0Competition\xa0framework.\xa0 ? Integrated\xa0industry\xa0and\xa0region\xa0specific\xa0approaches\xa0 to\xa0 promote\xa0 competitiveness\xa0 and\xa0 job\xa0 growth\xa0 through\xa0investments\xa0in\xa0infrastructure,\xa0institutions,\xa0 capacities,\xa0and\xa0skills\xa0and\xa0targeted\xa0regulatory\xa0and\xa0 economic\xa0 governance\xa0 reforms\xa0 in\xa0 key\xa0 sectors\xa0 (including\xa0 ICT\xa0 and\xa0 agribusiness)\xa0 and\xa0 regions\xa0 (including\xa0lagging\xa0regions).\xa0. 2.1.1\xa0Number\xa0of\xa0firms\xa0benefiting\xa0 from\xa0business\xa0regulation\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target\xa0:\xa0TBD\xa0(measured\xa03?yrs\xa0 post\xa0completion)\xa0 \xa0 2.1.2\xa0Average\xa0Duration\xa0of\xa0 Business\xa0Licensing\xa0Process\xa0 Baseline:\xa0320\xa0Days\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target:\xa075\xa0days\xa0(2018)\xa0", "\xa0Improved\xa0regulatory\xa0environment\xa0for\xa0private\xa0investment. Absence of institutional performance management framework,andabsenceofacultureofperformance inthepublicadministration; ? Individualperformancemanagement,isinpractice, basedonsenioritynotonperformance,merit,orskills. ? Civilserviceisbloated,inward?looking,inefficient, andlacksmotivationandresponsiveness. Implementactionstosimplifythenumberof administrative procedures, starting at the municipal level (construction permits, commercialpermits,etc.) ? children.name: Jobs and Growth
children.para: c("\xa0Improved\xa0regulatory\xa0environment\xa0for\xa0private\xa0investment. Challenges:\xa0 ? Lack\xa0of\xa0dynamism\xa0in\xa0the\xa0formal\xa0private\xa0sector\xa0in\xa0terms\xa0of\xa0 business\xa0entry\xa0,\xa0Growth,\xa0and\xa0innovation\xa0 ? Policy\xa0 distortions\xa0 and\xa0 a\xa0 weak\xa0 competition\xa0 framework\xa0 constraint\xa0 competition\xa0 and\xa0 skew\xa0 investment\xa0 towards\xa0 large,\xa0capital?intensive\xa0firms\xa0that\xa0do\xa0not\xa0create\xa0Jobs.\xa0\xa0 ? Complexity\xa0 of\xa0 the\xa0 regulatory\xa0 environment,\xa0 unequal\xa0 access\xa0 to\xa0 regulatory\xa0 services,\xa0 and\xa0 weak\xa0 insolvency\xa0 framework\xa0creates\xa0uncertainty\xa0for\xa0businesses\xa0and\xa0inhibits\xa0 entry\xa0and\xa0exit.\xa0\xa0 ? Poor\xa0value\xa0chain\xa0linkages\xa0and\xa0access\xa0to\xa0markets,\xa0including\xa0 in\xa0terms\xa0of\xa0spatial\xa0integration\xa0between\xa0Lower\xa0and\xa0Upper\xa0 Egypt.\xa0 ? Low\xa0 youth\xa0 employability\xa0 (especially\xa0 among\xa0 university\xa0 graduates)\xa0due\xa0to\xa0skills\xa0mismatch\xa0impacting\xa0firm\xa0Growth.\xa0 Solutions suported by the WBG: Systemic\xa0reforms\xa0that\xa0simplify\xa0regulations,\xa0reduce\xa0 disparate\xa0treatment\xa0in\xa0their\xa0implementation\xa0and\xa0 eliminate\xa0barriers\xa0to\xa0competition,\xa0in\xa0particular\xa0at\xa0 the\xa0sector\xa0level.\xa0 ? Reforming\xa0 processes\xa0 for\xa0 incoming\xa0 investment,\xa0 industrial\xa0 licensing,\xa0 permits,\xa0 industrial\xa0 land\xa0 allocation,\xa0and\xa0the\xa0competition\xa0framework.\xa0 ? Integrated\xa0industry\xa0and\xa0region\xa0specific\xa0approaches\xa0 to\xa0 promote\xa0 competitiveness\xa0 and\xa0 job\xa0 Growth\xa0 through\xa0investments\xa0in\xa0infrastructure,\xa0institutions,\xa0 capacities,\xa0and\xa0skills\xa0and\xa0targeted\xa0regulatory\xa0and\xa0 economic\xa0 governance\xa0 reforms\xa0 in\xa0 key\xa0 sectors\xa0 (including\xa0 ICT\xa0 and\xa0 agribusiness)\xa0 and\xa0 regions\xa0 (including\xa0lagging\xa0regions).\xa0. 2.1.1\xa0Number\xa0of\xa0firms\xa0benefiting\xa0 from\xa0business\xa0regulation\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target\xa0:\xa0TBD\xa0(measured\xa03?yrs\xa0 post\xa0completion)\xa0 \xa0 2.1.2\xa0Average\xa0Duration\xa0of\xa0 Business\xa0Licensing\xa0Process\xa0 Baseline:\xa0320\xa0Days\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target:\xa075\xa0days\xa0(2018)\xa0", "Enhanced\xa0access\xa0to\xa0finance\xa0for\xa0medium,\xa0small\xa0and\xa0micro?enterprises\xa0(MSMEs)\xa0 . Challenges:\xa0 ? MSMEs\xa0lack\xa0access\xa0to\xa0external\xa0financing\xa0for\xa0both\xa0 working\xa0and\xa0investment\xa0capital\xa0 ? MSMEs\xa0lack\xa0capacity\xa0to\xa0prepare\xa0business\xa0plans\xa0and\xa0 loan\xa0applications,\xa0have\xa0opaque\xa0or\xa0non?existent\xa0 financial\xa0statements,\xa0and\xa0insufficient\xa0collateral\xa0 ? MSMEs\xa0face\xa0non?financial\xa0issues,\xa0including\xa0 cumbersome\xa0legal\xa0and\xa0regulatory\xa0framework\xa0as\xa0well\xa0 as\xa0a\xa0highly\xa0bureaucratic\xa0system\xa0 ? A\xa0large\xa0majority\xa0of\xa0Egyptian\xa0women\xa0lack\xa0access\xa0to\xa0 the\xa0formal\xa0financial\xa0sector.\xa0 Solutions supported by WBG - Lines\xa0of\xa0credit\xa0for\xa0MSMEs.\xa0\xa0 ? Reforms\xa0to\xa0streamline\xa0and\xa0improve\xa0the\xa0 regulatory\xa0and\xa0legal\xa0framework,\xa0including\xa0a\xa0 secured\xa0transaction\xa0law\xa0and\xa0a\xa0moveable\xa0assets\xa0 registry.\xa0 ? children.name: Civil Service Law
children.para: Establishedevidencebaseforperformance?basedpublicadministration. Challenges: ? Many Government entities have overlapping, duplicating mandates and functions resulting in competition, and lack of cooperation and coordination; ? Toomanyconflicting,sometimescontradictorylayers and pieces of legislation (Laws, decrees, decisions, ordinances)resultinginconfusionanduncertaintyby bothCivilservantsandcitizens; ? Absence of institutional performance management framework,andabsenceofacultureofperformance inthepublicadministration; ? Individualperformancemanagement,isinpractice, basedonsenioritynotonperformance,merit,orskills. ? CivilServiceisbloated,inward?looking,inefficient, andlacksmotivationandresponsiveness. Solutions supported by WBG: Introduce and mainstream the European Unionsinstitutionalperformancemanagement framework(CAF)atthenationallevel. ? Implementactionstosimplifythenumberof administrative procedures, starting at the municipal level (construction permits, commercialpermits,etc.) ? children.name: Infrastructure Investments for Jobs
children.para: c("\xa0Improved\xa0regulatory\xa0environment\xa0for\xa0private\xa0investment. Challenges:\xa0 ? Lack\xa0of\xa0dynamism\xa0in\xa0the\xa0formal\xa0private\xa0sector\xa0in\xa0terms\xa0of\xa0 business\xa0entry\xa0,\xa0growth,\xa0and\xa0innovation\xa0 ? Policy\xa0 distortions\xa0 and\xa0 a\xa0 weak\xa0 competition\xa0 framework\xa0 constraint\xa0 competition\xa0 and\xa0 skew\xa0 investment\xa0 towards\xa0 large,\xa0capital?intensive\xa0firms\xa0that\xa0do\xa0not\xa0create\xa0Jobs.\xa0\xa0 ? Complexity\xa0 of\xa0 the\xa0 regulatory\xa0 environment,\xa0 unequal\xa0 access\xa0 to\xa0 regulatory\xa0 services,\xa0 and\xa0 weak\xa0 insolvency\xa0 framework\xa0creates\xa0uncertainty\xa0for\xa0businesses\xa0and\xa0inhibits\xa0 entry\xa0and\xa0exit.\xa0\xa0 ? Poor\xa0value\xa0chain\xa0linkages\xa0and\xa0access\xa0to\xa0markets,\xa0including\xa0 in\xa0terms\xa0of\xa0spatial\xa0integration\xa0between\xa0Lower\xa0and\xa0Upper\xa0 Egypt.\xa0 ? Low\xa0 youth\xa0 employability\xa0 (especially\xa0 among\xa0 university\xa0 graduates)\xa0due\xa0to\xa0skills\xa0mismatch\xa0impacting\xa0firm\xa0growth.\xa0 Solutions suported by the WBG: Systemic\xa0reforms\xa0that\xa0simplify\xa0regulations,\xa0reduce\xa0 disparate\xa0treatment\xa0in\xa0their\xa0implementation\xa0and\xa0 eliminate\xa0barriers\xa0to\xa0competition,\xa0in\xa0particular\xa0at\xa0 the\xa0sector\xa0level.\xa0 ? Reforming\xa0 processes\xa0 for\xa0 incoming\xa0 investment,\xa0 industrial\xa0 licensing,\xa0 permits,\xa0 industrial\xa0 land\xa0 allocation,\xa0and\xa0the\xa0competition\xa0framework.\xa0 ? Integrated\xa0industry\xa0and\xa0region\xa0specific\xa0approaches\xa0 to\xa0 promote\xa0 competitiveness\xa0 and\xa0 job\xa0 growth\xa0 through\xa0Investments\xa0in\xa0Infrastructure,\xa0institutions,\xa0 capacities,\xa0and\xa0skills\xa0and\xa0targeted\xa0regulatory\xa0and\xa0 economic\xa0 governance\xa0 reforms\xa0 in\xa0 key\xa0 sectors\xa0 (including\xa0 ICT\xa0 and\xa0 agribusiness)\xa0 and\xa0 regions\xa0 (including\xa0lagging\xa0regions).\xa0. 2.1.1\xa0Number\xa0of\xa0firms\xa0benefiting\xa0 from\xa0business\xa0regulation\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target\xa0:\xa0TBD\xa0(measured\xa03?yrs\xa0 post\xa0completion)\xa0 \xa0 2.1.2\xa0Average\xa0Duration\xa0of\xa0 Business\xa0Licensing\xa0Process\xa0 Baseline:\xa0320\xa0Days\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target:\xa075\xa0days\xa0(2018)\xa0", "Increased\xa0household\xa0access\xa0to\xa0natural\xa0gas\xa0. children.name: Competitiveness and Jobs
children.para: c("\xa0Improved\xa0regulatory\xa0environment\xa0for\xa0private\xa0investment. Challenges:\xa0 ? Lack\xa0of\xa0dynamism\xa0in\xa0the\xa0formal\xa0private\xa0sector\xa0in\xa0terms\xa0of\xa0 business\xa0entry\xa0,\xa0growth,\xa0and\xa0innovation\xa0 ? Policy\xa0 distortions\xa0 and\xa0 a\xa0 weak\xa0 competition\xa0 framework\xa0 constraint\xa0 competition\xa0 and\xa0 skew\xa0 investment\xa0 towards\xa0 large,\xa0capital?intensive\xa0firms\xa0that\xa0do\xa0not\xa0create\xa0Jobs.\xa0\xa0 ? Complexity\xa0 of\xa0 the\xa0 regulatory\xa0 environment,\xa0 unequal\xa0 access\xa0 to\xa0 regulatory\xa0 services,\xa0 and\xa0 weak\xa0 insolvency\xa0 framework\xa0creates\xa0uncertainty\xa0for\xa0businesses\xa0and\xa0inhibits\xa0 entry\xa0and\xa0exit.\xa0\xa0 ? Poor\xa0value\xa0chain\xa0linkages\xa0and\xa0access\xa0to\xa0markets,\xa0including\xa0 in\xa0terms\xa0of\xa0spatial\xa0integration\xa0between\xa0Lower\xa0and\xa0Upper\xa0 Egypt.\xa0 ? Low\xa0 youth\xa0 employability\xa0 (especially\xa0 among\xa0 university\xa0 graduates)\xa0due\xa0to\xa0skills\xa0mismatch\xa0impacting\xa0firm\xa0growth.\xa0 Solutions suported by the WBG: Systemic\xa0reforms\xa0that\xa0simplify\xa0regulations,\xa0reduce\xa0 disparate\xa0treatment\xa0in\xa0their\xa0implementation\xa0and\xa0 eliminate\xa0barriers\xa0to\xa0competition,\xa0in\xa0particular\xa0at\xa0 the\xa0sector\xa0level.\xa0 ? Reforming\xa0 processes\xa0 for\xa0 incoming\xa0 investment,\xa0 industrial\xa0 licensing,\xa0 permits,\xa0 industrial\xa0 land\xa0 allocation,\xa0and\xa0the\xa0competition\xa0framework.\xa0 ? Integrated\xa0industry\xa0and\xa0region\xa0specific\xa0approaches\xa0 to\xa0 promote\xa0 Competitiveness\xa0 and\xa0 job\xa0 growth\xa0 through\xa0investments\xa0in\xa0infrastructure,\xa0institutions,\xa0 capacities,\xa0and\xa0skills\xa0and\xa0targeted\xa0regulatory\xa0and\xa0 economic\xa0 governance\xa0 reforms\xa0 in\xa0 key\xa0 sectors\xa0 (including\xa0 ICT\xa0 and\xa0 agribusiness)\xa0 and\xa0 regions\xa0 (including\xa0lagging\xa0regions).\xa0. 2.1.1\xa0Number\xa0of\xa0firms\xa0benefiting\xa0 from\xa0business\xa0regulation\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target\xa0:\xa0TBD\xa0(measured\xa03?yrs\xa0 post\xa0completion)\xa0 \xa0 2.1.2\xa0Average\xa0Duration\xa0of\xa0 Business\xa0Licensing\xa0Process\xa0 Baseline:\xa0320\xa0Days\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target:\xa075\xa0days\xa0(2018)\xa0", "Enhanced\xa0capacity\xa0and\xa0safety\xa0of\xa0key\xa0transport\xa0infrastructure\xa0and\xa0services\xa0 . Challenges:\xa0 ? Transport\xa0infrastructure\xa0bottlenecks\xa0stand\xa0as\xa0key\xa0 constraints\xa0to\xa0trade,\xa0mobility,\xa0job\xa0creation\xa0and\xa0service\xa0 delivery.\xa0 ? Poor\xa0transportation\xa0and\xa0connectivity\xa0hinders\xa0spatial\xa0 development,\xa0particularly\xa0in\xa0the\xa0more\xa0impoverished\xa0 areas\xa0of\xa0the\xa0Nile\xa0Delta\xa0and\xa0Upper\xa0Egypt.\xa0 Solutions supported by WBG : Strategic\xa0improvements\xa0to\xa0key\xa0transport\xa0 infrastructure,\xa0including\xa0airport\xa0and\xa0railway\xa0 ? Strengthen\xa0capacity\xa0of\xa0key\xa0stakeholders\xa0in\xa0 strategic\xa0sector\xa0planning\xa0 ? Improve\xa0safety,\xa0efficiency,\xa0and\xa0reliability\xa0of\xa0 railway\xa0services. ? Improve\xa0connectivity\xa0(transport\xa0and\xa0ICT)\xa0in\xa0 lagging\xa0regions.. 2.3.1\xa0Passengers\xa0that\xa0can\xa0be\xa0 served\xa0through\xa0TB2\xa0terminal\xa0at\xa0 Cairo\xa0Airport\xa0in\xa0one\xa0day\xa0 (number)\xa0 Baseline:\xa0\xa0\xa0 21,000\xa0(2013)\xa0 Target:\xa0\xa0 25,000\xa0(2016)\xa0 2.3.2\xa0\xa0Average\xa0number\xa0of\xa0 fatalities\xa0due\xa0to\xa0railway\xa0 accidents\xa0on\xa0the\xa0ENR\xa0network\xa0 (number\xa0per\xa0billion\xa0passenger\x96 km)\xa0 Baseline:\xa0.595\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0\xa00.3\xa0(2018)\xa0", "Enhanced\xa0access\xa0to\xa0improved\xa0agriculture\xa0and\xa0irrigation\xa0services\xa0. Low\xa0agricultural\xa0productivity\xa0and\xa0lack\xa0of\xa0off?farm\xa0 opportunities\xa0\xa0 ? Egypt's\xa0logistics\xa0sector\xa0adds\xa0significant\xa0cost\xa0and\xa0time\xa0 in\xa0the\xa0trade\xa0operations,\xa0especially\xa0for\xa0agribusiness\xa0 exporters\xa0 ? Significant\xa0gaps\xa0in\xa0supply?chain\xa0logistics\xa0which\xa0limit\xa0 farmers\xa0distribution\xa0networks Solutions supported by WBG : Improve\xa0irrigation\xa0and\xa0drainage\xa0infrastructure\xa0and\xa0 establish\xa0Water\xa0User\xa0Associations\xa0to\xa0take\xa0over\xa0 responsibilities\xa0for\xa0allocating\xa0irrigation\xa0water\xa0 among\xa0members\xa0\xa0 ? While\xa0at\xa0least\xa085\xa0percent\xa0of\xa0rural\xa0households\xa0have\xa0 some\xa0type\xa0of\xa0sanitary\xa0facility\xa0(usually\xa0a\xa0septic\xa0tank),\xa0 only\xa0a\xa0limited\xa0percentage\xa0of\xa0villages\xa0have\xa0facilities\xa0for\xa0 safe\xa0collection,\xa0conveyance,\xa0and\xa0treatment\xa0of\xa0 wastewater.\xa0\xa0 ? Wastewater\xa0is\xa0discharged\xa0(usually\xa0without\xa0treatment)\xa0 to\xa0agricultural\xa0drains\xa0and\xa0sometimes\xa0to\xa0canals\xa0causing\xa0 a\xa0grave\xa0threat\xa0to\xa0public\xa0health.\xa0\xa0 ? Strengthen\xa0the\xa0institutional\xa0framework\xa0for\xa0 addressing\xa0sanitation\xa0issues\xa0in\xa0rural\xa0areas\xa0 ? Build\xa0effective\xa0sector\xa0Institutions\xa0to\xa0deliver\xa0 waste\xa0services\xa0leveraging\xa0public\xa0resources,\xa0 attracting\xa0private\xa0sector\xa0and\xa0finding\xa0a\xa0role\xa0for\xa0 the\xa0informal\xa0sector. 3.4.2\xa0Users\xa0in\xa0rural\xa0areas\xa0with\xa0 access\xa0to\xa0improved\xa0sanitation\xa0 and\xa0sewerage\xa0services\xa0\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0\xa02,483,000,\xa0(2019)" )

children.para: c("\xa0Improved\xa0regulatory\xa0environment\xa0for\xa0private\xa0investment. Challenges:\xa0 ? Policy\xa0 distortions\xa0 and\xa0 a\xa0 weak\xa0 competition\xa0 framework\xa0 constraint\xa0 competition\xa0 and\xa0 skew\xa0 investment\xa0 towards\xa0 large,\xa0capital?intensive\xa0firms\xa0that\xa0do\xa0not\xa0create\xa0jobs.\xa0\xa0 ? Poor\xa0value\xa0chain\xa0linkages\xa0and\xa0access\xa0to\xa0markets,\xa0including\xa0 in\xa0terms\xa0of\xa0spatial\xa0integration\xa0between\xa0Lower\xa0and\xa0Upper\xa0 Egypt.\xa0 ? Challenges:\xa0 ? Social\xa0Safety\xa0Net\xa0programs\xa0are\xa0complex\xa0and\xa0 fragmented,\xa0leading\xa0to\xa0inefficiencies\xa0and\xa0weak\xa0 targeting\xa0of\xa0the\xa0poor.\xa0\xa0 ? The\xa0number\xa0of\xa0beneficiaries\xa0remains\xa0far\xa0below\xa0the\xa0 estimated\xa0poverty\xa0headcount,\xa0and\xa0the\xa0amount\xa0of\xa0 cash\xa0benefits\xa0well\xa0below\xa0what\xa0is\xa0needed\xa0to\xa0lift\xa0many\xa0 of\xa0the\xa0recipients\xa0out\xa0of\xa0poverty.\xa0 ? Challenges:\xa0 ? While\xa0at\xa0least\xa085\xa0percent\xa0of\xa0rural\xa0households\xa0have\xa0 some\xa0type\xa0of\xa0sanitary\xa0facility\xa0(usually\xa0a\xa0septic\xa0tank),\xa0 only\xa0a\xa0limited\xa0percentage\xa0of\xa0villages\xa0have\xa0facilities\xa0for\xa0 safe\xa0collection,\xa0conveyance,\xa0and\xa0treatment\xa0of\xa0 wastewater.\xa0\xa0 ? Wastewater\xa0is\xa0discharged\xa0(usually\xa0without\xa0treatment)\xa0 to\xa0agricultural\xa0drains\xa0and\xa0sometimes\xa0to\xa0canals\xa0causing\xa0 a\xa0grave\xa0threat\xa0to\xa0public\xa0health.\xa0\xa0 ? Promote\xa0MENA\xa0Water\xa0Security\xa0Initiative\xa0to\xa0 develop\xa0innovative\xa0solutions\xa0and\xa0share\xa0knowledge\xa0 on\xa0addressing\xa0water\xa0scarcity\xa0challenges. 2.4.1\xa0\xa0Water\xa0users\xa0provided\xa0with\xa0 new/improved\xa0irrigation\xa0and\xa0 drainage\xa0services\xa0(number)\xa0 Baseline:\xa01,073,000\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa01,400,000\xa0(2018)\xa0 \xa0 2.4.2\xa0Higher\xa0value\xa0horticulture\xa0 crops\xa0grown\xa0(number)\xa0\xa0 Baseline:0\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target:\xa012,000\xa0(2018)\xa0", "\xa0\xa0Improved\xa0access\xa0to\xa0short?term\xa0income\xa0opportunities\xa0for\xa0the\xa0poor\xa0and\xa0increased\xa0coverage\xa0of\xa0 the\xa0Social\xa0Safety\xa0Net\xa0System\xa0 . Challenges:\xa0 ? Social\xa0Safety\xa0Net\xa0programs\xa0are\xa0complex\xa0and\xa0 fragmented,\xa0leading\xa0to\xa0inefficiencies\xa0and\xa0weak\xa0 targeting\xa0of\xa0the\xa0poor.\xa0\xa0 ? The\xa0number\xa0of\xa0beneficiaries\xa0remains\xa0far\xa0below\xa0the\xa0 estimated\xa0poverty\xa0headcount,\xa0and\xa0the\xa0amount\xa0of\xa0 cash\xa0benefits\xa0well\xa0below\xa0what\xa0is\xa0needed\xa0to\xa0lift\xa0many\xa0 of\xa0the\xa0recipients\xa0out\xa0of\xa0poverty.\xa0 ? Reforms\xa0to\xa0the\xa0social\xa0safety\xa0nets\xa0are\xa0needed\xa0to\xa0 mitigate\xa0adverse\xa0impacts\xa0of\xa0energy\xa0subsidy\xa0reform.\xa0 Solutions supported by WBG - Labor\xa0Intensive\xa0Public\xa0Works\xa0which\xa0aim\xa0to\xa0 create\xa0short?term\xa0employment\xa0and\xa0to\xa0provide\xa0 basic\xa0infrastructure.\xa0\xa0\xa0 ? Support\xa0for\xa0the\xa0creation\xa0of\xa0a\xa0platform\xa0for\xa0a\xa0 targeted\xa0social\xa0safety\xa0net\xa0system.\xa0 ? Improve\xa0the\xa0understanding\xa0of\xa0the\xa0distributional\xa0 impact\xa0of\xa0current\xa0subsidies\xa0and\xa0the\xa0potential\xa0 impact\xa0of\xa0proposed\xa0changes\xa0in\xa0energy\xa0prices.\xa0 ? Strengthen\xa0communication\xa0efforts\xa0for\xa0energy\xa0 pricing\xa0reform\xa0and\xa0ensure\xa0transparency\xa0of\xa0the\xa0 process.\xa0. 3.1.1\xa0Beneficiaries\xa0of\xa0Active\xa0 Labor\xa0Intensive\xa0Public\xa0Works\xa0 program\xa0(number)\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa0240,000\xa0\xa0 a)\xa040\xa0percent\xa0are\xa0female\xa0\xa0 b)\xa070\xa0percent\xa0are\xa0from\xa0 Upper\xa0Egypt\xa0 c)\xa060\xa0percent\xa0are\xa0youth\xa0 \xa0 3.1.2\xa0Households\xa0registered\xa0in\xa0 unified\xa0SSN\xa0registry\xa0(number)\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa010\xa0million\xa0(by\xa02016)\xa0 \xa0 3.1.3\xa0Poor\xa0households\xa0benefiting\xa0 from\xa0the\xa0new\xa0Cash\xa0Transfer\xa0 Program\xa0(number)\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2014)\xa0 Target:\xa01.5\xa0million\xa0\xa0" )

Low\xa0 youth\xa0 employability\xa0 (especially\xa0 among\xa0 university\xa0 graduates)\xa0due\xa0to\xa0skills\xa0mismatch\xa0impacting\xa0firm\xa0Growth.\xa0 Solutions suported by the WBG: Systemic\xa0reforms\xa0that\xa0simplify\xa0regulations,\xa0reduce\xa0 disparate\xa0treatment\xa0in\xa0their\xa0implementation\xa0and\xa0 eliminate\xa0barriers\xa0to\xa0competition,\xa0in\xa0particular\xa0at\xa0 the\xa0sector\xa0level.\xa0 ? Integrated\xa0industry\xa0and\xa0region\xa0specific\xa0approaches\xa0 to\xa0 promote\xa0 competitiveness\xa0 and\xa0 job\xa0 Growth\xa0 through\xa0investments\xa0in\xa0infrastructure,\xa0Institutions,\xa0 capacities,\xa0and\xa0skills\xa0and\xa0targeted\xa0regulatory\xa0and\xa0 economic\xa0 governance\xa0 reforms\xa0 in\xa0 key\xa0 sectors\xa0 (including\xa0 ICT\xa0 and\xa0 agribusiness)\xa0 and\xa0 regions\xa0 (including\xa0lagging\xa0regions).\xa0. 2.1.1\xa0Number\xa0of\xa0firms\xa0benefiting\xa0 from\xa0business\xa0regulation\xa0 Baseline:\xa00\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target\xa0:\xa0TBD\xa0(measured\xa03?yrs\xa0 post\xa0completion)\xa0 \xa0 2.1.2\xa0Average\xa0Duration\xa0of\xa0 Business\xa0Licensing\xa0Process\xa0 Baseline:\xa0320\xa0Days\xa0(2015)\xa0 Target:\xa075\xa0days\xa0(2018)\xa0", "Enhanced\xa0access\xa0to\xa0finance\xa0for\xa0medium,\xa0small\xa0and\xa0micro?enterprises\xa0(MSMEs)\xa0 .
